Calculate emitted thermal radiation

Source: R/energybalance_functions.R
Qemitted_thermal_radiation.Rd

estimate thermal radiation (W) emitted by the surface of an animal. Follows Gates' Biophysical Ecology and Spotila et al. 1992. Reference: Spotila et al. 1992. Biophysics of Heat and Mass Transfer. In Feder and Burggren. Environmental Physiology of the Amphibians; Porter et al. 1973. Behavioral implications of mechanistic ecology. Oecologia 13:1-54.

Qemitted_thermal_radiation(
  epsilon = 0.96,
  A,
  psa_dir,
  psa_ref,
  T_b,
  T_g,
  T_a,
  enclosed = FALSE
)

Arguments

epsilon

longwave infrared emissivity of skin (proportion), 0.95 to 1 for most animals (Gates 1980)

A

surface area in m^2

psa_dir

proportion surface area exposed to sky (or enclosure)

psa_ref

proportion surface area exposed to ground

T_b

body surface temperature in K

T_g

ground surface temperature in K

T_a

ambient air temperature in K, only required if animal is in enclosed environment

enclosed

TRUE or FALSE

Value

emitted thermal radiation, Qemit (W)

See also

Other biophysical models: Free_or_forced_convection(), Grashof_number_Gates(), Grashof_number(), Nu_from_Gr(), Nu_from_Re(), Nusselt_number(), Prandtl_number(), Qconduction_animal(), Qconduction_substrate(), Qconvection(), Qevaporation(), Qmetabolism_from_mass_temp(), Qmetabolism_from_mass(), Qnet_Gates(), Qradiation_absorbed(), Qthermal_radiation_absorbed(), Reynolds_number(), Tb_CampbellNorman(), Tb_Fei(), Tb_Gates2(), Tb_Gates(), Tb_butterfly(), Tb_grasshopper(), Tb_limpetBH(), Tb_limpet(), Tb_lizard(), Tb_mussel(), Tb_salamander_humid(), Tb_snail(), Tbed_mussel(), Tsoil(), actual_vapor_pressure(), boundary_layer_resistance(), external_resistance_to_water_vapor_transfer(), heat_transfer_coefficient_approximation(), heat_transfer_coefficient_simple(), heat_transfer_coefficient(), saturation_vapor_pressure(), saturation_water_vapor_pressure()

Examples

Qemitted_thermal_radiation(
  epsilon=0.96,
  A=1, 
  psa_dir=0.4, 
  psa_ref=0.6, 
  T_b=303, 
  T_g=293, 
  T_a=298, 
  enclosed=FALSE)
